job_title: Service Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Work level is manageable, have freedom to implement changes and take ownership of program. Good pay for entry level job, good benefits.
cons: No leveling or opportunity for raises, small nonprofit. To advance in career have to use the job as a stepping stone.

job_title: Great Place to Volunteer in Edmonton, AB
pros:
Great Experience 
Helps the community 
Cooperative and friendly team 
Organized
cons:
Long hours 
Standing, running, and lots of physical labor 
Fast paced and work under pressure to meet the needs of the homeless

pros: Volunteering to feed the homeless was an amazing experience that I learned lots from. Serving helped me develop skills working in fast paced environments. Interacting with the homeless helped me better understand their special needs. And working with other volunteers helped give me a sense of teamwork. Overall great volunteer experience that helped prepared me for future work.
cons: No cons! Although constant standing and running can be tiring, that's just part of the work.

review_title: Has potential of being a nice place to work but.....
job_title: Resource Specialist/Services Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Enthusiastic team of direct service workers who care about our community, really rewarding work with clients and community members, Ok benefits
cons:
Leadership lacks personal accountability and skills necessary to get necessary to motivate, inspire and support employees.  
Instead of providing guidance and encouragement Leadership uses fear and intimidation (including egregious disciplinary action) to pressure workers into unrealistic demands and outcomes.  
Leadership often takes credit for employee’s ideas, time consuming special projects and contributions to organization. without acknowledging employees efforts or showing appreciation.  
Almost no room for growth within the organization, No opportunities for training or professional development,
Very high turnover and shortages in essential are ongoing
Workers are supposed to receive 1-on-1 supervision but leadership frequently cancels it.
unfair and inequitable hiring practices, 
Unsafe working conditions (tripping hazards and clutter) that could result in serious injuries of staff. 
No procedures or training to deal with physically aggressive or dangerous client's putting direct service staff at risk for serious physical harm and life-threatening situations. 
Leaderships communication skills are severely lacking (Staff are almost never notified of important changes to agency operations, office policies or crucial changes in their job descriptions, work expectations other necessary information).
 Employees are required to attend lengthy multiple staff meetings weekly and assigned to last minute tasks outside of their job description with very little notice making it very difficult to have admin time and perform the necessary functions of their jobs.
 Office culture and work environment is divisive, high stress and disorganized making it very difficult for employees to work together as team.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Ability to work with community 
Room to grow and move up 
Ability to make change in the community
cons: There are always more people in need than time.

pros: Great team, meaningful work, very flexible
cons: Executive Director is absent almost always, senior management is lacking
